win_version.query: select tb1.name, tb1.build_version, (case when (arch like '%-bit') then concat('x', replace(arch,'-bit', '')) else arch end) as arch, 'Microsoft' as publisher, tb2.version from (select name, version as build_version, arch from os_version) tb1,(select data as version from registry where path = 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\DisplayVersion') tb2;
win_version.name: win_version
win_version.description: Retrieves the name, version number, build version, and arch of the target Windows system.

kernel_info.name: os-image
kernel_info.description: Retrieves information from the current kernel in the target system.

chrome_extensions.query: select chrome_extensions.* from users join chrome_extensions using (uid);
chrome_extensions.description: Retrieves the list of extensions for Chrome in the target system.

firefox_addons.query: select firefox_addons.* from users join firefox_addons using (uid);
firefox_addons.description: Retrieves the list of addons for Firefox in the target system.

vscode_extensions.query: select vscode_extensions.* from users join vscode_extensions using (uid);

browser_plugins.query: select browser_plugins.* from users join browser_plugins using (uid);
browser_plugins.description: Retrieves the list of C/NPAPI browser plugin in the target system.

ie_extensions.query: select ie_extensions.* from users join ie_extensions using (uid);
ie_extensions.description: Retrieves the list of extensions for IE in the target system.

opera_extensions.query: select opera_extensions.* from users join opera_extensions using (uid);
opera_extensions.description: Retrieves the list of extensions for opera in the target system.

safari_extensions.query: select safari_extensions.* from users join safari_extensions using (uid);
safari_extensions.description: Retrieves the list of extensions for safari in the target system.

windows_programs.description: Retrieves the list of products as they are installed by Windows Installer in the target Windows system.

windows_patches.description: Retrieves all the information for the current windows drivers in the target Windows system.

windows_drivers.description: Retrieves all the information for the current windows drivers in the target Windows system.

windows_shared_resources.description: Retrieves the list of shared resources in the target Windows system.

appcompat_shims.query: SELECT * FROM appcompat_shims WHERE description!='EMET_Database' AND executable NOT IN ('setuphost.exe','setupprep.exe','iisexpress.exe');
appcompat_shims.description: Appcompat shims (.sdb files) installed on Windows hosts.

pipes_snapshot.query: SELECT processes.path, processes.cmdline, processes.uid, processes.on_disk, pipes.name, pid FROM pipes JOIN processes USING (pid);

wmi_cli_event_consumers.description: WMI CommandLineEventConsumer, which can be used for persistence on Windows. See https://www.blackhat.com/docs/us-15/materials/us-15-Graeber-Abusing-Windows-Management-Instrumentation-WMI-To-Build-A-Persistent%20Asynchronous-And-Fileless-Backdoor-wp.pdf for more details.

wmi_filter_consumer_binding.description: Lists the relationship between event consumers and filters.

wmi_cli_event_consumers_snapshot.description: Snapshot query for WMI event consumers.

certificates.query: SELECT * FROM certificates WHERE path != 'Other People';
certificates.description: List all certificates in the trust store.

etc_hosts.description: List the contents of the Windows hosts file.

listening_ports.query: SELECT DISTINCT process.name, listening.port, listening.protocol, listening.family, listening.address, process.pid, process.path, process.on_disk, process.parent, process.start_time FROM processes AS process JOIN listening_ports AS listening ON process.pid = listening.pid;
listening_ports.description: List all processes and their listening_ports.
